member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.PreferredPlacingTypeBase
member.summary: The PreferredPlacingTypeBase class is the base class for the preferred placing type. You can set the PreferredPlacingType in the object's attributes to specify how your object should be placed in the drawing. Please note that not all objects accept all types. If you try to use the wrong type it will not be accepted (Insert, Modify will fail). To use valid types you should use the named defaults (PreferredTextPlacingTypes for Text, PreferredMarkPlacingTypes for Mark, PreferredSymbolPlacingTypes for Symbol).

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.AlongLinePlacingType.#ctor

member.summary: The AlongLineOrWithLeaderLineAndParentObjectAlongPartPlacingType class defines a placing type that places the object using the along line placing as the first option. If there is no room for the first option the fallback option will be used. The fallback option is placing the object with a leader line and rotated to be at the same angle as the connected part.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.AlongLineOrWithLeaderLineAndParentObjectAlongPartPlacingType.#ctor

member.summary: Creates a new leader line and parent object along part placing type instance.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.InsidePartAlongPartOrWithLeaderLinePlacingType
member.summary: The InsidePartAlongPartOrWithLeaderLinePlacingType class defines a placing type that places the object using the base line placing as the first option. If there is no room for the first option the fallback option will be used. The fallback option is placing the object with a leader line. The base line used is in the middle of the part, aligned with the part.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.InsidePartAlongPartOrWithLeaderLinePlacingType.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new inside part along part or with leader line placing type instance.

member.summary: The InsidePartHorizontalOrWithLeaderLinePlacingType class defines a placing type that places the object using the base line placing as the first option. If there is no room for the first option the fallback option will be used. The fallback option is placing the object with a leader line. The base line used is in the middle of the part, aligned with the part. In addition the object will be rotated to be horizontal in the drawing.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.PluginPickerInput
member.summary: The PluginPickerInput class represents a predefined set of picker inputs that can be provided to a plug-in object. It replaces the interactive selection of points and/or objects by the user when the plug-in is inserted into a drawing through the API.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.Symbol
member.summary: The Symbol class defines a drawing object that is displayed as a symbol in a drawing. Symbols are located in the environment directory under the folder named "symbols" in .sym files that can contain up to 255 symbols. Symbol files can be created with SymEd. See the Tekla Structures help for more information.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler
member.summary: The DrawingHandler class initializes the interface from a .NET application to Tekla Structures. This object must be created before any actions can be performed on Tekla Structures drawings. When this object is created, it is possible to ask the current active drawing in Tekla Structures, get a list of drawings or create a new drawing.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new drawing handler instance, a "handle" to Tekla.Structures.Drawing. When a drawing handler object is created, it is possible to ask the current active drawing in Tekla Structures, get a list of drawings or create a new drawing.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetActiveDrawingIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the identifier for active drawing

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetActiveDrawingType
member.summary: Gets the type of active drawing

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetConnectionStatus
member.summary: Returns true if a proper connection to the Tekla Structures process has been established. A proper connection to Tekla Stuctures in the drawing API needs Tekla Structures up and running and a model open. If, for some reason, the connection has been lost, the method will return false. Currently, there's no way to re-establish the connection.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.SetMessageExecutionStatus(Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.MessageExecutionModeEnum)
member.summary: Sets the message execution mode for the application.
member.param: The new mode.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetMessageExecutionStatus
member.summary: Gets the current message execution mode for the application.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetDrawings

member.returns: All the drawings from the database.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetDrawingSelector
member.summary: Gets a drawing selector. With a drawing selector the list of selected drawings can be gotten.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetDrawingObjectSelector
member.summary: Gets a drawing object selector. With a drawing object selector drawing objects can be selected and highlighted in the drawing editor. A drawing object selector also provides a list of currently selected drawing objects.
member.returns: The drawing object selector for the current drawing. Null if no drawing is active.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.GetPicker

member.returns: A picker object if the drawing editor is open. Otherwise null.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.MessageExecutionModeEnum
member.summary: The message execution modes of Tekla Structures.

remarks.para: The message execution mode of Tekla Structures controls whether messages are executed after each database operation or by an explicit call to execute messages.
There may be some speed benefits if the BY_COMMIT mode is used when inserting a lot of objects. The messages are then executed once after the objects have been inserted.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.MessageExecutionModeEnum.INSTANT
member.summary: Executes messages after each database operation. All objects appear instantly on the screen when using the INSTANT mode.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.DrawingHandler.MessageExecutionModeEnum.BY_COMMIT
member.summary: Executes messages only when Drawing.CommitChanges() is called.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.Events
member.summary: The Events class allows the user to register event listeners for drawing events.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous event handling
Registered event handlers are called asynchronously so that many handlers may be running simultaneously. Event handlers are not guaranteed to be run in the same thread where they were registered. The asynchronous nature of the events requires the use of synchronization constructs on objects and data structures that are not defined to be thread safe.
Microsoft's documentation about the lock statement: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c5kehkcz.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about delegates: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/900fyy8e.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about managed threading: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1c9txz50.aspx

member.summary: The RectangleBoundingBox class represents a bounding box for an object, i.e. the surrounding box of the object. The bounding box contains the calculated corner points of the box. The rectangle bounding box is inherited from the axis-aligned bounding box. The AABB also contains methods for getting the center point of the box.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.UI.Events
member.summary: The Events class allows the user to register event listeners for drawing user interface events.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous event handling
Registered event handlers are called asynchronously so that many handlers may be running simultaneously. Event handlers are not guaranteed to be run in the same thread where they were registered. The asynchronous nature of the events requires the use of synchronization constructs on objects and data structures that are not defined to be thread safe.
Microsoft's documentation about the lock statement: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c5kehkcz.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about delegates: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/900fyy8e.aspx
Microsoft's documentation about managed threading: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1c9txz50.aspx

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.Grid.GridTextPlacement
member.summary: The different placing options for the Text labels on a Grid. Use OR operator (|) to combine more than one option. Ex. GridBottom | GridLeft, to show Text labels on both left and bottom of grid. TextPosition = (GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.OnlyText | GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.GridBottom | GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.GridRight | GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.GridTop | GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.GridLeft); The above code makes the gridlines invisible but shows all the text labels of the grid.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Drawing.GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement
member.summary: The different placing options for the Text on a Grid Line. Use OR operator (|) to combine more than one option. Ex. LineStart | LineEnd, to show Text on both start and end. TextPosition = (GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.OnlyText | GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.LineStart | GridLine.GridLineTextPlacement.LineEnd); The above code makes the gridlines invisible but shows all the text labels of the lines.
